name: Measure
title: Measure
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Clinical Quality Information)
description: The Measure resource provides the definition of a quality measure.

elements.name: Measure
elements.description: The Measure resource provides the definition of a quality measure.

elements.name: url
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this measure when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

elements.name: version
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance.

elements.name: name
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the measure.

elements.name: title
elements.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the measure.

elements.name: subtitle
elements.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the measure giving additional information about its content.

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of this measure. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

elements.name: experimental
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this measure is authored for testing purposes and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

elements.name: subjectCodeableConcept
elements.description: The intended subjects for the measure.

elements.name: subjectReference
elements.description: The intended subjects for the measure.

elements.name: date
elements.description: The date (and optionally time) when the measure was published.

elements.name: publisher
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the measure.

elements.name: contact
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

elements.name: description
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the measure from a consumer's perspective.

elements.name: useContext
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed.

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the measure is intended to be used.

elements.name: purpose
elements.description: Explanation of why this measure is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

elements.name: usage
elements.description: A detailed description of how the measure is used from a clinical perspective.

elements.name: copyright
elements.description: A copyright statement relating to the measure and/or its contents.

elements.name: approvalDate
elements.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher.

elements.name: lastReviewDate
elements.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed.

elements.name: effectivePeriod
elements.description: The period during which the measure content was or is planned to be in active use.

elements.name: topic
elements.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the measure.

elements.name: author
elements.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

elements.name: editor
elements.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

elements.name: reviewer
elements.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

elements.name: endorser
elements.description: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

elements.name: relatedArtifact
elements.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

elements.name: library
elements.description: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the measure.

elements.name: disclaimer
elements.description: Notices and disclaimers regarding the use of the measure or related to intellectual property (such as code systems) referenced by the measure.

elements.name: scoring
elements.description: Indicates how the calculation is performed for the measure, including proportion, ratio, continuous-variable, and cohort.

elements.name: compositeScoring
elements.description: If this is a composite measure, the scoring method used to combine the component measures to determine the composite score.

elements.name: type
elements.description: Indicates whether the measure is used to examine a process, an outcome over time, a patient-reported outcome, or a structure measure such as utilization.

elements.name: riskAdjustment
elements.description: A description of the risk adjustment factors that may impact the resulting score for the measure and how they may be accounted for when computing and reporting measure results.

elements.name: rateAggregation
elements.description: Describes how to combine the information calculated, based on logic in each of several populations, into one summarized result.

elements.name: rationale
elements.description: Provides a succinct statement of the need for the measure. Usually includes statements pertaining to importance criterion: impact, gap in care, and evidence.

elements.name: clinicalRecommendationStatement
elements.description: Provides a summary of relevant clinical recommendation statements from major clinical practice guidelines.

elements.name: improvementNotation
elements.description: Information on whether an increase or decrease in score is the preferred result (e.g., a higher score indicates better quality OR a lower score indicates better quality OR quality is within a range).

elements.name: definition
elements.description: Provides a description of an individual term used within the measure.

elements.name: guidance
elements.description: Additional guidance for the measure including how it can be used in a clinical context, and the intent of the measure.

elements.name: group
elements.description: A group of population criteria for the measure.

elements.name: supplementalData
elements.description: The supplemental data criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression within a referenced library, or a valid FHIR Resource Path.
